awd_titl_txt: Technical Support for the US Antarctic Program
awd_abstract_narration: The National Science Foundation (NSF) and the U.S. Army Cold                    Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory (CRREL) have entered                into an agreement to have CRREL provide engineering consultation                for Antarctic operations.                                                                                                                                       The purpose of this award is to provide funding for 3 members of                CRREL to make a site visit to Antarctica to assess Antarctic                    conditions and advise NSF management in the following three                     areas:                                                                                                                                                                  * Life Expectancy Prediction for South Pole                                                                                                                     * Feasibility Study on Hard-Surface Runway for McMurdo and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   South Pole Stations.                                                                                                                                               * Waste Management Study for Antarctic Stations.                                                                                                        Upon completion of the site visits, CRREL will submit a new                     proposal to NSF for additional funding.                                                                                                                         The acting program manager recommends funding of this action.
